results.title: Simvastatin preconditioning confers neuroprotection against hypoxia-ischemia induced brain damage in neonatal rats via autophagy and silent information regulator 1 (SIRT1) activation.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ preconditioning confers neuroprotection against @DISEASE_Hypoxia @DISEASE_MESH:D000860 @@@hypoxia@@@-@DISEASE_Ischemia @DISEASE_MESH:D007511 @@@ischemia@@@ induced @<m>DISEASE_Brain_Damage_Chronic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001925 @@@brain damage@@@ in neonatal @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ via autophagy and @GENE_SIRT1 @GENE_309757 @@@silent information regulator 1@@@ (@GENE_SIRT1 @GENE_309757 @@@SIRT1@@@) activation.

results.title: Prophylactic but not delayed administration of simvastatin protects against long-lasting cognitive and morphological consequences of neonatal hypoxic-ischemic brain injury, reduces interleukin-1beta and tumor necrosis factor-alpha mRNA induction, and does not affect endothelial nitric oxide synthase expression.
results.text_hl: BACKGROUND AND PURPOSE: Prophylactic administration of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ has been shown to protect against @<m>DISEASE_Brain_Damage_Chronic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001925 @@@brain damage@@@ and its long-lasting behavioral consequences in neonatal @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@.

citations.NLM: Balduini W, Mazzoni E, Carloni S, De Simoni MG, Perego C, Sironi L, Cimino M. Prophylactic but not delayed administration of simvastatin protects against long-lasting cognitive and morphological consequences of neonatal hypoxic-ischemic brain injury, reduces interleukin-1beta and tumor necrosis factor-alpha mRNA induction, and does not affect endothelial nitric oxide synthase expression. Stroke. 2003 Aug;34(8):2007-12. PMID: 12829860

results.title: Simvastatin protects against long-lasting behavioral and morphological consequences of neonatal hypoxic/ischemic brain injury.
results.text_hl: Herein, we studied whether a prophylactic administration of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ (@<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Sim@@@) provides significant protection against @<m>DISEASE_Brain_Damage_Chronic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001925 @@@brain damage@@@, and we sought to determine its long-lasting behavioral consequences in a neonatal model of @DISEASE_Hypoxia @DISEASE_MESH:D000860 @@@hypoxia@@@/@DISEASE_Ischemia @DISEASE_MESH:D007511 @@@ischemia@@@.

citations.NLM: Balduini W, De Angelis V, Mazzoni E, Cimino M. Simvastatin protects against long-lasting behavioral and morphological consequences of neonatal hypoxic/ischemic brain injury. Stroke. 2001 Sep;32(9):2185-91. PMID: 11546915

results.title: Effects of simvastatin on the expression of intercellular adhesion molecule-1 mRNA in neonatal brain with hypoxic-ischemic damage.
results.text_hl: Both @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ and @CHEMICAL_6_chloro_3_5_diaminopyrazine_3_carboxamide @CHEMICAL_MESH:C058206 @@@CDPC@@@ can relieve the @<m>DISEASE_Brain_Damage_Chronic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001925 @@@damages of the brain@@@ in @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ with @DISEASE_Hypoxia_Brain @DISEASE_MESH:D002534 @@@HIBD@@@.

results.title: Simvastatin reduces secondary brain injury caused by cortical contusion in rats: possible involvement of TLR4/NF-kappaB pathway.
results.text_hl: Administration of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ following @DISEASE_Brain_Injuries_Traumatic @DISEASE_MESH:D000070642 @@@TBI@@@ significantly ameliorated the secondary @<m>DISEASE_Brain_Damage_Chronic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001925 @@@brain damage@@@, such as cortical apoptosis, @DISEASE_Brain_Edema @DISEASE_MESH:D001929 @@@brain edema@@@, blood-brain @DISEASE_Glut1_Deficiency_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:C536830 @@@barrier (BBB)@@@ impairment, and @DISEASE_Neurologic_Manifestations @DISEASE_MESH:D009461 @@@motor deficits@@@.

citations.NLM: Chen G, Zhang S, Shi J, Ai J, Qi M, Hang C. Simvastatin reduces secondary brain injury caused by cortical contusion in rats: possible involvement of TLR4/NF-kappaB pathway. Exp Neurol. 2009 Apr;216(2):398-406. PMID: 19166837
